articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Minor in G# (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Minor in G# (Shape: C)

## Brief Description
In music theory, an arpeggio is when the notes of a chord are played individually in succession rather than simultaneously. The Minor arpeggio in the key of G# played in the shape of C consists of the notes G#, B, and D#.

## Notes and Intervals
- G# (Root)
- B (Minor third)
- D# (Fifth)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
Minor arpeggios are commonly used in various genres such as jazz, blues, and rock. The Minor arpeggio in G# has a melancholic and emotional feel due to the minor tonality. When played in the shape of C on guitar, it can create tension and depth in the music, adding a haunting or bittersweet quality to the sound.

## Songs
Here are 3 songs that feature the Minor arpeggio in the Key of G#:
1. "Stairway to Heaven" by Led Zeppelin
2. "Hotel California" by Eagles
3. "Blackbird" by The Beatles
